< NEW YORK AREA
INAUGURATION OF HELICOPTER SERVICE
NEW JERSEY-NEW YORK METROPOLITAN AREA-OCTOBER 15, 1952

THE PORT OF NEW YORK AUTHORITY
111 Sighth Avenue-at 15th Street New York 11 Ny
ALGONQUIN 5-1000
AVIATION DEPARTMENT
Fred M. Glass
DIRECTOR
October 15, 1952
To Friends of The Port of New York Authority:
This letter was carried on the first regularly scheduled helicopter air mail flight in
the New Jersey-New York Port District.
This flight from La Guardia Airport to New York International Airport to Newark
Airport on October 15, 1952 marks the first step in the establishment of regular air mail,
freight, and passenger transportation by helicopter in this area. The Port of New York Authority
wishes to take this opportunity to congratulate New York Airways, Inc., on the establishment
of helicopter air mail service at this time and to express once more our firm belief in the future
of the helicopter as a method of short-haul transportation.
For the next few months, New York Airways will operate regular helicopter air mail
flights on a triangular route serving La Guardia, Newark, and New York International Airports.
When additional equipment becomes available, the company will extend this
suburban points which it has been authorized to serve by the Civil Aeronautics Board.
Eventually, helicopter service will also carry cargo and passengers on these routes and on
shuttle routes connecting Manhattan with the airports.
We are convinced that the helicopter can contribute greatly to the solution of the
serious traffic problems in large metropolitan areas. Its ability to overcome surface obstacles
and to land or take off in small places enables it to create an entirely new level of vehicular
movements. We are proud on the occasion of this first flight to welcome New York Airways to
the family of carriers serving the world's greatest regional airport system.
Please accept the First Flight Air Mail Cachet in which this message is enclosed
as our memento to you on this occasion.
Herbert O. Fisher
Chief, Aviation Development Division
properties.sfomuseum:creditline: Gift of the Pottorff Family in memory of George B. Pottorff, Jr.
properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover commemorating first airmail flight by helicopter in the New York area, AM-111; purple cachet with image of helicopter with New York skyline in background; along bottom right edge, "Inauguration of Helicopter Service New Jersey-New York Metropolitan Area-October 15, 1952”; postmarked October 15, 1952 in New York with four-line cancellation mark over 6-cent stamp; backstamp: October 15, 1952, New York. a. Envelopeb. Letter from The Port of New York Authority signed by Herbert O. Fisher, Chief, Aviation Development Division; "This letter was carried on the first regularly scheduled helicopter air mail flight in the New Jersey-New York Port District"
